title: Interesting numbers on Sheffield watch
content:
When my grandfather died a few years ago, I got his watch. I've always been struck by the numbers on the face; I've never really seen anything like them. If you could tell me if these numbers or numbers like these can be found in any font, I'd appreciate it.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317141036im_/http:/typophile.com/files/IMG_0502_5792.JPG)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317141036im_/http:/typophile.com/files/IMG_0503_6414.JPG)

Sorry that I can't get an image that's not blurry.
author: DrDoc

comments.content: Have you considered photographing your watch under sufficient light; or placing both the camera and the subject on a steady surface? Increasing distance between camera and subject? If available, utilizing a macro feature? Flatbed scanner?

Taking the watch off your wrist might help too. Using a scanner would be best if the watch has a flat glass. If it is too curved the scanner's light might get reflected too much.

I'd really like to see these numbers.
